label: 内侍司
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Its leading members were in constant attendance on the Emperor, caring for his personal needs and transmitting his commands.  They also supervised a subordinate staff of 100 female servants (Nyoju), participated in the staging of official ceremonies, and acted as guardians of the Sacred Mirror.  In order of importance, their titles were Principal Handmaid, Assistant Handmaid, and Handmaid (p. 821). [[女孺、神鏡、尚侍（ないしのかみ）、典侍（ないしのすけ）、掌侍（ないしのじょう）]
